title: The Global Inventory
content: Most of the biomass is found in plants. Bacteria and archaea are micro-organisms most of which are located in deep subsurface environments. Protists are micro-organisms found in almost any environment that contains liquid water. Fungi and animals are heterotrophs: they feed on other living organisms. Viruses are made up of organic material but are technically not alive. Being tiny, they are abundant in many environments, despite having a small contribution to the total biomass.

title: The Animal Kingdom
content: Animals are mainly marine, dominated by fish and arthropods. We then find an abundance of life forms underground (terrestrial arthropods, nematodes and annelids). Wild mammals comprise only a tiny fraction, smaller than 1%, of the animal biomass. Today, humans weigh about 10 times more than all wild mammals. To generate enough proteins, humans have created livestock that now weighs almost twice the entire world population.
